answers.author: Jesse Himes
answers.text:
Hi Aubrey,
It’s important for websites to stay up to date with the changes that seem to happen every day, so thanks for asking! I found some links that may be useful to you:
This article from Public Management Magazine has some great tips on why it’s important to keep up with the changes and includes a few tips. 
http://webapps.icma.org/pm/9507/public/tech.cfm?title=Tech%20Touch&subtitle=&author=
A similar question was asked by one of our members a few months ago; the answers that it received may help you too.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/questions/question/22900
Keep asking great questions!
Jesse Himes, Knowledge Network Intern, jhimes@icma.org

author: Aubrey Roark
text:
I am looking for examples from government or university of website content style guides that provide rules or best practices for things like grammar, formatting, etc. 
An example from the private industry is Mail Chimp http://mailchimp.com/about/style-guide/#grammar-and-more.
title: Website Content Style Guides
